column5: I expose myself to them and then they die of laughter - sigh

I have a small baseball bat that I got when I went to Jerry Park to watch Rusty Staub and the Expos play.  It is about 18" long and great for whacking fish. Note that this only works for real fish, abnormal giant Pennsylvania bass will grab it off of you and hit you with it. It has worked well so far. Jim

I have a 70's cop billy club that is like a priest bat.  Works well.  This year I'm going to try the club and cut after the club. for those that don't cut and just club.  when you filet the fish, put it in a ziplock bag with a full beer overnight and it takes all the blood out of the meat and makes it very tasty.

For pretty much my whole life I'd just let them die in a dry livewell but after talking to a couple chef students I know they tell me that the flesh will be a lot better if the fish dies quickly...if you don't kill them quickly apparently lactic acid and toxins get into the flesh which isn't tasty, so bleeding them wouldn't be my first choice... Screwdriver straight threw the brain in my opinion is the quickest way...next question Flat head or Phillips?  -Ben
Ben, go Canadian and use the flat head.
If he wanted to go "Canadian".. he'd have to use a Robertson !!!
Ah I should have known that I had it wrong.  The sun, fishing with skeeter today and a beer just now threw me off.  Well I tried...  Use a dang knife!

Just limited out on laker in the Lake of Bays last weekend and for the first time we trying the cutting of the gills technique.  I was very surprised of how fast the fish expired after the cuts.  It seemed very quick and humane..  Just remember to let the fish bleed awhile in the net, or it could get messy
I don't imagine the sun or the beer had anything to do with it....
Correct    so next time you are near OSH airport let skeert and I know so we can join you for some fishing and get this sorted out...
Knife between the eyes slightly back.  Art
.12 ga with no.2 shot
This sword should be good for fish up to the size of groupers-->
I use my knife or pliers and whack them on the top of the head, seems to work fine for me. Might get something a little bigger this year though since I plan on keeping more fish then I usually have.
Walleye, cut their throat' bleed out in the live well, allot cleaner filleting, meat is nice and white.
I use the wunder boner while they are still alive.
The Best Way To Kill The Fish Is To Throw It Back In The Water And Let Some Other Predator Fish Kill It.
Heavy hunting knife and sever the spine behind the head. Quick.  To those of you who let a fish slowly suffocate to death, I suggest you use any other method that's quicker and more humane.

So I'm curious, I've only been fishing a few seasons and been keeping some of my catch over the past year.  I've always found it a bit difficult to kill the fish quickly.  I usually will give it a swift whack to the head and sometimes it'll knock it out, other times it takes a another whack or two.  I've seen others bleed them to death (even on the spot) and others break the spine.  I'm interested to know what's everyone elses opinion on it?  I think a quck death is better than a slow one.  I'm mostly referring to walleye, perch and pike.

i bring an old cooler.. throw them on ice and they start to "fall a sleep".. and in the mean time while fishing it keeps ur drinks cold.. tho i have had to knock them out with a few methods.. but my girlfriend doesnt exactly enjoy that method

I used to break the spine, but have recently begun using one of those small wooden bats, that are about 20" long.  It fits in one of my rod holders perfectly, and actually came with the used boat that I got a few years back.  One swift shot to the head, and they fall asleep.  Only used it once or twice on fish that are mortally wounded.  You can get the glow in the dark "fish bashers" at crappy tire, same thing..
If I'm keeping the fish for consumption, I bleed them. A quick cut with my scissors, through the gills and much better quality of meat. I've never had one complain. HH
I bore them to death with past heroic tales of great feats---if that fails---gotta big stick

For consumption it is better to bleed them first.Cut their throats and hold them by the tail to bleed, better done at the water. If there bigger I just give em a good punch to the head. Maybe this is a good thread to see everyones priests (bonker) cause I have seen some dandies in my time on the water. I don't have one.

I had never seen, no heard of a priest until I spent a couple of summer vacations in Scotland. Everyone carries them there, and some are quite elaborate, and even lead filled. Here, if we're keeping them to eat, it's on the stringer until we get back to the camp, then a swift beheading, (I make custom knives, and this is always a good test). It's always interesting to see how long the pike head will keep snapping after it's removed from the body.
I use the Tony Soprano method, sneak up behind them and give them one in the back of the head!!
The perfect technique  http://www.youtube.ca/watch?v=rQhfknFrlA0&feature=related
I agree with bleeding them.
Here's the method I use.  Take your filet knife and insert the point in the top of the head and come down between the eyes half an inch..... instant kill.... no fuss no pain Leechman
I use a priest - not a very elaborate one though...    Seems to be the easiest, most humane way to me.

I wait for them to finish spawning and then die like salmon   ...If I was a fish, I couldn't think of any better way of going  Most of the time I just dump them into a cooler full of ice or if they're big enough, take a branch and whack them on their head...With that said I rarely keep the fish I catch.  I've never tried bleeding a fish but from what I've read, the meat tastes so much better.
You have to kill them first...
Gollum style. But bring a toothbrush for after.
Same here, I use a priest followed by bleeding them. After they are brain dead their heart will beat for up to 10 minutes which is enough to bleed them out.

Wow so many quick replys, thanks  I think I'll take some of the advice here and try bleeding them after knocking them out next time, sounds like a simple way of finishing them off & getting the blood out to keep the meat fresh.  Cheers

Actually I have a homemade bat that a friend wood worker turn out of Pennsylvania White Ash that we would get as firewood from "The Bat Factory" in Akeley Pa...my high school friend Brad could make anything from wood and with his lathe it was a easy chore and something I have had for over 30 years...it's much heavier than any of the cheap pine ones you sometimes see sold in tackle stores.
I introduce them to " XXXEDITXXX"s wife, after 5 minutes they commit suicide..........      I guess using his name wasn't a good idea

Eat a mean ceaser salad with lots of garlic before you go fishing, then breath on them when u  bring one into the boat, they should drop  and be going for a long But on a more helpful note, we have tried bonking and cutting.  What seems to work well is to bring out the bonker and then cut. I agree with Dutchy, It still seems to drain well and for sure there is a big difference in the flavor.

That's the method I use if my club is't in the boat.  It does work well..   Question for the guys who bleed the fish.  How much of a difference does it really make in the flavour of a fish??  Does it make it less "fishy", or what??
I LIKE TERRY'S TIP ALSO, maybe I shouls bring my mother in law fishing after all.............. .......naww what was I thinking, I would not last 5 minutes.

day and night is the difference...as anything your going to eat ....bleed it out ...and when cleaning remove the lateral line....  My method of bleeding a fish out is slice the gills and poke the tail on the lateral line with your fillet knife...let the heart pump the blood into the river...

All depends on the type of fish I guess. I just throw panfish or walleye in a plastic bag and stick them in the fridge.  Then clean them once they're dead and cold.  I find them much easier to clean after being in the fridge also. Never had any complaints from anyone eating them after doing this.
but I thought fish like Garlic ?!
